intro: Maerua oblongifolia var. glabra, commonly known as smooth maerua, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves that are typically elliptical or oblong in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in spring. Its leaves are adapted to reduce water loss, featuring a waxy cuticle and small size. This species is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of forage for livestock.
